content.en: Gene prioritization: Scientists are using algorithms to prioritize candidate genes for diseases by analyzing protein-protein interaction networks. These algorithms, such as PageRank and HITS, can identify genes that are most likely to be associated with a particular disease. By integrating different types of networks and using network-based scoring methods, researchers are improving the prediction of disease-gene associations and identifying molecular networks underlying human diseases.
content.da: Gen-prioritering: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at prioritere kandidatgener for sygdomme ved at analysere protein-protein interaktionsnetværk. Disse algoritmer, såsom PageRank og HITS, kan identificere gener, der mest sandsynligt er forbundet med en bestemt sygdom. Ved at integrere forskellige typer netværk og bruge netværksbaserede vurderingsmetoder, forbedrer forskere forudsigelsen af sygdom-gen associationer og identificerer molekylære netværk, der ligger til grund for menneskelige sygdomme.
